definition: self/oneself/sixth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/sixth in order/letter "F" or Roman "VI" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/hexa

sentences.english: Be strict to oneself , be more tolerant to others .
sentences.chinese: 嚴於律己，更要寬以待人。

sentences.english: Love the people, strict in request the oneself, serve society, create the brilliancy together.
sentences.chinese: 愛民，嚴於律己，服務社會，共創輝煌。

sentences.english: "Tolerate to others, discipline myself" was also a teaching from him.
sentences.chinese: “與人爲善，嚴於律己”是祖父教導的家訓。

sentences.english: Self-disciplined, disciplines students well, has strong responsibility, friendly to students.
sentences.chinese: 教師能夠嚴於律己，教風嚴謹，責任心強，態度友好。

sentences.english: The word "Self-denial" means restraining being strict with oneself.
sentences.chinese: “自我否定”一詞意味着嚴於律己。

sentences.english: Disciplined senior manager with superior customer penetrating and priority development capabilities;
sentences.chinese: 嚴於律己，且有豐富的重點客戶開發及滲透的能力。

definition: to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
not to submit to force (idiom); to defy threats and violence
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
to be content with what one is
to seek the cause in oneself rather than sb else
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
to praise the virtue of sb or sth while concealing their faults
